items.title: Master of Public Policy
items.subtitle: Blavatnik School of Government, University of Oxford
items.text: Pursued a broad range of courses in philosophy, political science, law, and policy evaluation, with a particular focus on comparative technology policy, media ecosystems, and free expression.

items.title: MSc, Social Science of the Internet
items.subtitle: Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford
items.text: Studied platform economics, internet law, social dynamics, and digital media, receiving a distinction on a thesis studying the relationships mediated by journalistic email newsletters.

items.title: BA, Journalism & Computer Science
items.subtitle: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
items.text: Graduated with Highest Distinction, double-majoring in journalism and computer science with a minor in entrepreneurship. Relevant coursework includes: Software Architecture, Interactive Journalism, Big Data Ethics, UX design, Multimedia Storytelling and Emerging Technologies.

items.title: Robertson Scholar
items.subtitle: Duke University
items.text: Joined a selective scholarship program as a “dual citizen” of both UNC and Duke, studying and living at both schools. Coursework: Algorithmic Journalism, Politics and Media, Fact-Checking and Profile Writing.

items.title: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology
items.subtitle: Software Engineering
items.text: I attended a selective STEM high school, graduating with a concentration in software engineering.

items.title: The Financial Times
items.subtitle: Graphics Journalist, Visual Investigations
items.text: Worked on long-term investigative projects with computational reporting methods and open-source intelligence, using visual storytelling methods to share the results with readers.

items.title: The Washington Post
items.subtitle: Newsroom Engineer, Elections
items.text: Wrote software as a hybrid journalist-engineer covering data-driven stories like the Olympics, COVID-19, and the U.S. elections. Designed new visualizations, created stable data pipelines, and built cloud infrastructures serving millions of users.

items.title: Reese News Innovation Lab
items.subtitle: Research Fellow
items.text: Led software development and UX research projects studying data visualization and AR/VR experiences for news, building internal prototypes and projects for partner organizations like The Washington Post.

items.title: The Guardian
items.subtitle: Data Reporting Contributor
items.text: Built data pipelines and results pages for the 2018 U.S. midterms and 2020 primaries with the Visuals desk, writing data stories about climate change, campaign finance, and gun violence between the two elections.

items.title: The Wall Street Journal
items.subtitle: Graphics Intern
items.text: Reported on corporate news, scraped data, performed statistical analyses, and designed front-page graphics for the paper's Business and Finance section both online and in print.

items.title: NBC
items.subtitle: Multimedia Journalism Intern
items.text: Produced videos, graphics, and digital investigations for NBC News, developing reusable data analysis tools and designing interactive storytelling components across 15 owned-and-operated local websites.

items.title: The Delta Center
items.subtitle: Media Intern
items.text: Helped run teacher training workshops for the National Endowment for the Humanities: planning logistics, making photos and videos, and designing digital and printed marketing.

items.title: CustomInk
items.subtitle: Software Engineering Intern, eCommerce
items.text: Rebuilt a critical inventory management system for the eCommerce engineering team, improving load times and reliability of a system processing tens of thousands of transactions per day.

items.title: nvite
items.subtitle: Software Engineering Intern
items.text: Architected, built and launched a new “communities” feature for the start-up events platform, which was eventually cited as a key reason for their eventual acquisition by Eventbrite in 2017.

items.title: 2020 Elections: Live Results
items.subtitle: Data, Graphics
items.text: I designed, architected, and built multiple parts of the Post’s election night coverage, including data pipelines, vote modeling, data visualizations, and integration across our native apps.

items.title: 2020 Elections: Tracking the Early Vote
items.subtitle: Data, Engineering
items.text: I built a system to aggregate early voting and turnout data from all 50 states, analyzing and visualizing results for this tracker that ran for a month and appeared on the front page of both web and print editions.

items.title: Teachers for Bernie, Retirees for Trump: Who's backing whom in 2020
items.subtitle: Data, Graphics
items.text: I built a database to help Guardian reporters analyze campaign finance filings from presidential hopefuls, then used that data to write multiple stories about donor demographics.

items.title: Gun violence has sharply declined in the Bay Area. What happened?
items.subtitle: Data, Graphics
items.text: I led design, development and data visualization for this story on gun violence in the San Francisco Bay Area.

items.title: 2018 US Midterms: Live Results
items.subtitle: Data, Engineering
items.text: I designed and built portions of The Guardian's elections stack, including backend data parsing, a staging environment, front-end components, and post-election graphics analyzing the results.

items.title: Facebook, the New Frontier of Political Ads
items.subtitle: Writing, Interactive
items.text: An investigative story and interactive about the habits of political advertisers on Facebook, using scraped data even before the release of the company's Ad Archive API.

items.title: "Things Have Got to Change": Affordable Housing in Chapel Hill
items.subtitle: Writing
items.text: A profile of Yvette Matthews, an activist for affordable housing amid soaring rents in Chapel Hill.

items.title: Email Newsletters and the Changing Journalist-Audience Relationship
items.text: Conducted a mixed-methods research study exploring the growth of independent email newsletters as a journalistic form and the platform’s impacts on both writers and readers.

items.title: Escaping Flatland: The user experience of data visualizations in augmented reality
items.text: My undergraduate thesis studied the user experience of augmented reality journalism, designing my own AR graphics and conducting user tests to create guidelines for future designs.

items.title: Local News on Facebook: Assessing the Critical Information Needs
items.text: Created and analyzed a database of more than 300,000 local news stories distributed on Facebook, to examine what types of local news are produced and shared on the platform.

items.title: “How is Social Media Gatekeeping Different?”: A multi-platform comparative analysis
items.text: Scraped data across years of print, web, and social media stories from the New York Times to examine how different types of news are prioritized and spread across each platform.

items.title: Middle Common Room, Exeter College Oxford
items.subtitle: President (2023-); Social Secretary (2022)
items.text: Worked closely with fellows, participated in the College's governing body, planned social events, and supported the community of graduate students in the Middle Common Room.

items.title: Rhodes Technology and Society Forum
items.subtitle: Co-Chair, Networked Society
items.text: Selected speakers, led planning, and moderated panels in the “Networked Society” track of the Rhodes Trust’s first annual conference on technology ethics and governance.

items.title: UNC Faculty Council
items.subtitle: Student Representative
items.text: Served as a liaison between faculty and students on campus policy issues, leading student input on a redesign of general eduction curriculum in the College of Arts & Sciences.

items.title: Robertson Community Council
items.subtitle: Co-Director
items.text: Served as a student voice to the Robertson Scholars program leadership and board of directors.
